protocol.name: P-G9721-1
protocol.text: Plants were prepared by growing the seeds in the rapeseed research field of Institute of Oil Crops Research, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences.

protocol.name: P-G9721-2
protocol.text: Flower buds were isolated from B. napus and were dissected on intact plants under the same growth conditions from the same field. The flower buds that are <1, 1, 2, 3 and >3 mm were harvested. All harvested samples including stamens and pistils were removed and immediately (<2 sec) frozen in liquid nitrogen to minimize post-harvest changes in gene expression. Flower buds were collected from at least two different biological repetitions within each line, from between two and four inflorescences on each plant, and from between two and four different plants from each line. Different flower bud samples were collected at approximately the same time of the day to avoid diurnal effects on gene expression.

protocol.name: P-G9721-3
protocol.text: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 10 ug total RNA (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA, USA).

protocol.name: P-G9721-4
protocol.text: Total RNA was isolated from flower buds using Trizol reagent following instructions from the manufacturer (Invitrogen Corporation, Carlsbad, CA, USA), and was then purified on RNeasy columns (Qiagen, Valencia, CA, USA). Total RNA with an absorbance A260/A280 ratio >1.8 was used for further analysis.
